intro: Myrsine paniensis, commonly known as the Panié myrsine, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are berries that turn red when mature, attracting various bird species. Myrsine paniensis is often found in moist, shaded forest habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of its endemic ecosystem.
